item.title: Report X-2023031170
item.description:
Report X-2023031170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-05T03:10:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-10
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) WAS WORKING ON AN AFFECTED CART OF WHAT APPEARED TO BE PAINT AFFECTED BOXES. DR FOUND THE LEAKING BOX ON THE CART. AFTER TRIAGAING THE BOX, DR DETERMINED THE LEAKER WAS A 1 GALLON BUCKET OF BENJAMIN MOORE ULTRA SPEC 500 INTERIOR PAINT - FLAT WHITE. DR FOUND THE SAFETY DATA SHEET (SDS) AND PER SECTION 14 OF THE SDS, THAT PRODUCT IS NOT REGULATED. DR ALSO FOUND 5 AEROSOL CANS THAT STATED KNOX PAINT COMPANY - STONE WHITE. DR ALERTED RESPONSIBLE MANAGEMENT PERSON (RMP) WHO PROCEEDED TO CONTACT THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SERVICE CENTER (HMSC). AFTER SPEAKING WITH TARA, A HMSC REPRESENTATIVE, THIS SHIPMENT WAS DEEMED AS UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023030584
item.description:
Report X-2023030584

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-05T03:10:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-28
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE THE DOOR 7 TRAILER. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE LEAKING CONTENTS CONSISTED OF TWO SEPARATE ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL PRODUCTS. THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO PSC FOR PROCESSING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION OF THE PACKAGE AND LEAKING PRODUCTS SUGGESTED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS SUSPECTED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT AND CONTACTED THE HMSC. PACKAGE WILL BE PLACED ON HOLD FOR ADG COMPLIANCE.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T21:08:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-13
  • City: CENTRAL POINT
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0945 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UMO. It was reported that approximately 2-quarts of UN1133 "Helmistik 1523" released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a pressure crack towards the bottom of the drum. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3178590. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Terminal personnel cleaned the impacted area with absorbents. The damaged drum and all cleanup debris were then placed into a 65-gallon metal drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: The package was discovered after the consignee refused the shipment. Once the package got back to the station the agent heard a distinctive rattling of a spray paint can in the package. The outer package showed no indications of dangerous goods being contained within. There was no shippers declaration included. The employee and their manager opened up the package and found an aerosol spray paint can. DG Admin advised them to hold the package until further instructed.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA as a damage. Upon investigation, it was found that the container contained four 1 gallon containers of chlorinating liquid, which is considered a class 8 hazmat. Package was listed as an ORMD on FTrack, but outer packaging contained no hazard labels. DescribePack: One container of chlorinating liquid was crushed, causing internal leakage. Contents were triple bagged, but liquid still leaked through. No loose caps were found, but inside of bags were wet. Spill remained contained inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Entire box was placed in a plastic hazardous material bag, then placed in a salvage drum. Damaged container was separated from the undamaged ones.

item.title: Report E-2022120163
item.description:
Report E-2022120163

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T21:08:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-29
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0205 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UPO. It was reported that unknown amount of Stabrex ST70 UN1824 was released from 275 gallon tote due to unknown cause during transit. The release impacted trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a loose fittings as they found the cap was not bolted and secured correctly. The cap was secured for tote shipment. Sodium bicarb was utilized to neutralize the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2022120090
item.description:
Report I-2022120090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T21:08:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-25
  • City: Portland
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON 10/15 AT APPROXIMATELY 1000 THE STATION AT MRIA CONTACTED DG ADMIN ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE FOUND DURING THE MORNING SORT. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE THAT THIS WAS A DANGEROUS GOOD OR ANY SHIPPERS DECLARATION OF DANGEROUS GOODS. ONE OF THE HANDLERS BROUGHT IT TO THE CSAS FOR REPACKING. AN EMPLOYEE BEGAN TO DO THE REWRAP AND GOT SOME OF THE GEL ON THEIR HANDS. ONCE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT IT WAS A DANGEROUS GOOD, AFTER REVIEWING THE SAFETY DATA SHEET, THEY STOPPED AND WASHED THEIR HANDS THOROUGHLY. NO MEDICAL ATTENTION WAS REQUIRED. EMPLOYEE SHOWS NO SIGNS OF AFTER EFFECTS. TWO BOTTLES IN THE PACKAGE HAD LOOSE CAPS AND HAD LEAKED APPROXIMATELY 0.5L COMBINED. THE INSIDE OF THE BOX SHOWED EXTREME SIGNS OF CORROSION. THE COMMODITY WAS DRANO MAX GEL. CLASSIFIED AS UN1760 CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S. (SODIUM HYDROXIDE, SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE), 8, PGIII. DG ADMIN INSTRUCTED THEM TO PLACE THE PACKAGE IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND TO HOLD THE SHIPMENT UNTIL FURTHER ADVISED.

  • Description: ODOT HM inspector identified the Vacuum Relief Valve releasing pressure during routine car inspections while in Klamath Falls railyard. The inspector notified BNSF personnel who isolated the car. A contractor was mobilized to inspect and secure the car. The VRV flange was removed from the car and a blind flange installed. UTLX to reinstall a like VRV in place of blank flange prior to movement. Shipper notified to obtain an OTMA for further movement.

item.title: Report E-2022100684
item.description:
Report E-2022100684

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T21:08:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-29
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1340 ET, XPO logistics terminal UPO called to request assistance with a one-cup release of UN179, Omnibrite from 3-1 gallon poly jugs due to the trailer straps creating small holes in the jugs. The spill is contained within its cardboard packaging and is sitting on the dock, only impacting concrete. ERTS dispatched Patriot to conduct cleanup. At 1555 ET, Patriot personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons of product released to a 3' x 3' area of the dock and freight stacked on a pallet. A total of (16) 1 gallon poly jugs of product were collected and containerized due to damage and placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. Various other products were found to be impacted and were separated and containerized. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected along with all impacted cardboard and cleanup debris into a 30 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

AFFECTED MATERIAL AND PACKAGE TRANSPORTED TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. INSPECTION REVEALED THE LID ON THE BUCKET WAS COMPROMISED. PRODUCT DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO DMP PROCEDURE REQUIRED FOR CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID.

  • Description: On July 18, 2022, Landstar called ERTS requesting a contractor to address a reported spill of UN 1760. Following contractor arrival and cargo assessment, it was concluded that multiple 5-gallon pails were damaged when a pallet shifted from lack of securement because only one securement strap was used to secure the entire cargo load. A total of 15 containers were leaking and/or damaged from this incident. Media affected was subsequently addressed and waste generated, including damaged and/or leaking cargo, is currently pending disposal.

  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) RECEIVED A CALL REGARDING A LEAKING PACKAGE AND SEVERAL AFFECTED PACKAGES. DR RETRIEVED LEAKING PACKAGE AND AFFECTED PACKAGES. DR DETERMINED AFTER TRIAGE THAT PACKAGES WERE AFFECTED BY SPARKLING WATER. DR OPENED AFFECTED PACKAGES AND FOUND THAT THERE WAS 75% HAND SANITIZER PACKED IN ONE OF THE AFFECTED PACKAGES WITHOUT ANY DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. DR ADVISED SUPERVISOR WHO THEN CALLED THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SERVICE CENTER (HMSC) FOR FURTHER CLARIFICATION. HMSC DETERMINED THAT PACKAGE WAS IN FACT UNDECLARED AND TO FOLLOW THE UNDECLARED PROCESS.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading waste containers from the transport trailer on 06/21/2022, the driver noticed that a small amount of waste material had been released from a carboy. Ingenium's incident investigation team determined that the likely cause of the release was due to a cross-threaded cap on the waste carboy. The spilled material was confined to Ingenium's trailer and did not otherwise make contact with the environment. Upon inspection and investigation, it was determined that the likely root cause of this release was due to a training deficiency for the driver.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS CALLED IN TO THE PSC AT APPROXIMATELY 11:31 AS A LEAKING HAZMAT. NOTICED THAT THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS LABELLED AS A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE, BATTERIES WET FILLED WITH ACID. ADDITIONALLY, THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN LOADED ON ITS SIDE. A WET SPOT WAS PRESENT BELOW THE PACKAGE, READING AT APPROXIMATELY 0-1 PH, BUT NO ADJACENT PACKAGES WERE AFFECTED BY THE SPILL. ALL SPILL RESIDUE WAS NEUTRALIZED, ABSORBED, AND RETURNED TO THE PSC ALONG WITH THE LEAKING PACKAGE. THE BATTERY ITSELF WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH AUTOMOTIVE, AS PER RMP INSTRUCTION, AND ALL AFFECTED MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP. NO CONTENTS WERE SALVAGEABLE.

item.title: Report E-2022060127
item.description:
Report E-2022060127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T21:08:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-27
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Bulk Service Transport DBA James J. Williams
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: System Transport reported 5-gallons of UN2672 "Aqua Ammonia" released on impacting the trailer and concrete below from a 6,000 gallon airline tanker. ERTS dispatched Northwest Hazmat to conduct all onsite cleanup operations. At 1900 ET Northwest arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 to 4-gallons of product released to a 2-feet (ft.) by 6-ft. soil area. Northwest personnel conducted excavation activities and utilized hand tools to a 5-ft. by 7-ft. by 6-inches in depth impacted soil area. The excavation was based on the pH of soil samples that were collected. The excavated area was backfilled with imported gravel. The contractor collected and containerized the excavated soils into poly bags. All waste was transported off site for disposal.

  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) RECEIVED A CALL FROM THE UNLOAD REGARDING A LEAKING PACKAGE. DR WENT TO DOOR 36 AT THE UNLOAD AND FOUND A LEAKING PACKAGE AND ONE AFFECTED PACKAGE. DR BROUGHT BOTH PACKAGES BACK TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER (PSC) AND PROCEEDED TO START TRIAGE. DR NOTED THERE WERE NOT ANY DIAMOND MARKINGS ON THE OUTER BOX. DR OPENED THE BOX AND FOUND FOUR SMALLER BOXES, EACH PACKED WITH SIX AEROSOL CANS. EACH OF THE SMALLER BOXES ALSO HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND MARKING ON ONE SIDE. DR CONSULTED WITH RESPONSIBLE MANAGEMENT PERSON (RMP) ABOUT THE MULTIPLE BOXES AND AEROSOL CANS.

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-10
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS CALLED IN FOR RESPONSE AT 12:10 ON 5/10/22. WHEN I ARRIVED TO THE PACKAGE, WHICH WAS ACROSS FROM DOOR 16 ON THE WEST PRIMARY BELT, I NOTED THAT THE PACKAGE (LABELLED AS CLASS 5.1 AND CLASS 8, HYDROGEN PEROXIDE AQUEOUS SOLUTIONS) WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM AND DISCOLORED. AFTER PLACING THE PACKAGE UPRIGHT IN A SPILL TOTE, THE BELT AND SURROUNDING PACKAGES WERE CHECKED FOR ANY SPILL RESIDUE (NONE FOUND). THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE INNER PACKAGING LEAKED DUE TO A LOOSE LID. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP AS A LIQUID WITH ALL CONTAMINATED ORGANIC MATERIAL SEPARATED INTO A SEPARATE BAG AS PER THE 5.1 RESPONSE SHEET.

item.title: Report X-2022050417
item.description:
Report X-2022050417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-04T21:08:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-02
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKER AT DOOR 12. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED THEY DISCOVERED 7 HAZMAT PACKAGES THAT WERE WET ON THE BOTTOM. THIS PACKAGE WAS THE SOURCE OF THE SPILL. IT WAS A FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING 2 PLASTIC JUGS. BOTH JUGS HAD LOOSE LIDS CAUSING THE MATERIAL TO SPILL OUTSIDE THE PACKAGING ONTO THE FLOOR AND SURROUNDING PACKAGES. THERE WAS NO INNER CUSHIONING IN THE BOX. RESPONDER BROUGHT PACKAGES BACK TO PSC FOR PROCESSING.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package noticed to be stained during unloading. Package placed into tote and taken to haz cage for further processing DescribePack: Package wet on outside. Four inner packages also wet. Leakage observed from two inner bottles with loose lids. Bottle did have safety seals, but leaked regardless. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed into salvage tote/drum.
